string.name: cat_card_action_move_top_left
string.description: A description of an action that a user of an accessibility service can perform to move the card to the top left corner of the screen. [CHAR LIMIT=25]

string.name: cat_card_action_move_up
string.description: A description of an action that a user of an accessibility service can perform to swap the card with the one above it. [CHAR LIMIT=25]

string.name: cat_card_action_move_down
string.description: A description of an action that a user of an accessibility service can perform to swap the card with the one below it. [CHAR LIMIT=25]

string.name: cat_card_action_move_top_right
string.description: A description of an action that a user of an accessibility service can perform to move the card to the top right corner of the screen. [CHAR LIMIT=25]

string.name: cat_card_action_move_bottom_left
string.description: A description of an action that a user of an accessibility service can perform to move the card to the bottom left corner of the screen. [CHAR LIMIT=25]

string.name: cat_card_action_move_bottom_right
string.description: A description of an action that a user of an accessibility service can perform to move the card to the bottom right corner of the screen. [CHAR LIMIT=25]

string.name: cat_card_action_move_center
string.description: A description of an action that a user of an accessibility service can perform to move the card to the center of the screen. [CHAR LIMIT=25]

resources.string: Sets the time between the first reflection and the reverberation.
Sets the volume level at 5 kHz relative to the volume level at low frequencies of the overall reverb effect. This controls a low-pass filter that will reduce the level of the high-frequency.
Sets the volume level of the late reverberation. This level is combined with the overall room level.

This parameter sets the level of the first group of echoes that occurs when sound waves hit walls, ceilings, etc. These reflections tend to be more defined and sound more like “echo” than “reverb.” Lowering the early reflections level also places the listener further back in the room, and more toward the middle.
Simulates the amount of time it takes for a sound to leave its sound source and create a first reflection. Increase to give the feeling of a bigger space.

Lower densities give more space between the reverb’s first reflections and subsequent reflections. A lower density creates a hollow sound that is useful for simulating small reverberation spaces such as bathrooms.

Increasing diffusion puts reflections closer together, thickening the sound. Reducing diffusion creates more discrete echoes. Sets the echo density in the late reverberation decay. The scale should approximately map linearly to the perceived change in reverberation.
This determines how long it takes for the reflections in the room to run out of energy. Sets the time taken for the level of reverberation to decay by 60 dB.

With reverbs having separate decay times for high and low frequencies, this sets the decay of high frequencies. A longer high frequency decay gives a brighter, more ethereal type of reverb that can sound great on vocals as it adds more reverb to sibilants and fricatives, while minimizing reverb on plosives and lower vocal ranges. Sets the ratio of high frequency decay time (at 5 kHz) relative to the decay time at low frequencies.

Represents the size of the room where the reverb is created. Larger sizes typically correlate to longer reverb times, vary this parameter in conjunction with decay time for a smoother sound. Sets the master volume level of the environmental reverb effect.
